libvmaf: use _XOPEN_SOURCE, not _POSIX_C_SOURCE

On BSD operating systems (I tested FreeBSD and NetBSD), with
_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L, M_PI (needed by src/feature/ciede.c) is not
exposed.

_XOPEN_SOURCE=600 exposes a superset of _POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L,
including M_PI.

libvmaf: use _XOPEN_SOURCE, not _POSIX_C_SOURCE

On BSD operating systems (I tested FreeBSD and NetBSD), with
_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L, M_PI (needed by src/feature/ciede.c) is not
exposed.

_XOPEN_SOURCE=600 exposes a superset of _POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L,
including M_PI.

avoid_unused_cuda_copy.commit_message: libvmaf/cuda: avoid unneeded device to host copy
[fix #1103] remove duplicate unreffing in ciede.c
fix usage of "neg" models due to missing option alias

libvmaf: use _XOPEN_SOURCE, not _POSIX_C_SOURCE

On BSD operating systems (I tested FreeBSD and NetBSD), with
_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L, M_PI (needed by src/feature/ciede.c) is not
exposed.

_XOPEN_SOURCE=600 exposes a superset of _POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L,
including M_PI.

libvmaf: use _XOPEN_SOURCE, not _POSIX_C_SOURCE

On BSD operating systems (I tested FreeBSD and NetBSD), with
_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L, M_PI (needed by src/feature/ciede.c) is not
exposed.

_XOPEN_SOURCE=600 exposes a superset of _POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L,
including M_PI.

libvmaf: use _XOPEN_SOURCE, not _POSIX_C_SOURCE

On BSD operating systems (I tested FreeBSD and NetBSD), with
_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L, M_PI (needed by src/feature/ciede.c) is not
exposed.

_XOPEN_SOURCE=600 exposes a superset of _POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L,
including M_PI.

libvmaf: use _XOPEN_SOURCE, not _POSIX_C_SOURCE

On BSD operating systems (I tested FreeBSD and NetBSD), with
_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L, M_PI (needed by src/feature/ciede.c) is not
exposed.

_XOPEN_SOURCE=600 exposes a superset of _POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L,
including M_PI.

libvmaf: use _XOPEN_SOURCE, not _POSIX_C_SOURCE

On BSD operating systems (I tested FreeBSD and NetBSD), with
_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L, M_PI (needed by src/feature/ciede.c) is not
exposed.

_XOPEN_SOURCE=600 exposes a superset of _POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L,
including M_PI.

libvmaf/cuda: avoid unneeded device to host copy
[fix #1103] remove duplicate unreffing in ciede.c

libvmaf: use _XOPEN_SOURCE, not _POSIX_C_SOURCE

On BSD operating systems (I tested FreeBSD and NetBSD), with
_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L, M_PI (needed by src/feature/ciede.c) is not
exposed.

_XOPEN_SOURCE=600 exposes a superset of _POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L,
including M_PI.

libvmaf: use _XOPEN_SOURCE, not _POSIX_C_SOURCE

On BSD operating systems (I tested FreeBSD and NetBSD), with
_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L, M_PI (needed by src/feature/ciede.c) is not
exposed.

_XOPEN_SOURCE=600 exposes a superset of _POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L,
including M_PI.
